original:
The taxonomy of lichens was first extensively studied by the Swedish botanist Erik Acharius (1757–1819), who is often referred to as the "father of lichenology." Acharius was a student of Carl Linnaeus and made significant contributions to the field, marking the establishment of lichenology as a distinct scientific discipline. His notable works include:

- - - - 
Subsequent lichenologists have expanded upon Acharius's foundational work.

The taxonomy of lichens was first extensively studied by the Swedish botanist Erik Acharius (1757–1819), who is often referred to as the "father of lichenology." Acharius was a student of Carl Linnaeus and made significant contributions to the field, marking the establishment of lichenology as a distinct scientific branch. His notable works include:

Subsequent lichenologists have expanded upon Acharius's foundational work.
